messages: 6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (15:55): hi would it be hard to convert a laptop keyboard into a normal one  ? :p
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (15:55): I need wireless anyways.
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (15:55): what would be the point?
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (15:56): spending more money than necessary ?
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (15:56): Shirakawasuna, yeah I thought I had a great idea, but I didn't think it through too much :p
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (15:56): will buy this one http://www-131.ibm.com/content/product_images/en_US/IMG2091_MKT_IMG_FILENAME_1.gif
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (15:56): but 99 euro, not very cheap for a keyboard
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (15:58): trackpoint on a desktop keyboard is just genious :p
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (15:58): lots of money
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (15:59): I use my thumb w/ the trackpad
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (15:59): easier on the hands

6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (15:59): yeah it is, but now I have a wireless keyboard and mouse, and the mouse is just one strange extra item I have to pick up to move that mouse pointer :p I like the trackpoint on laptop keyboards.
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:00): Shirakawasuna, you happen to know a budget laptop with those features ?
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:00): I have a dell b130 :)
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:01): no wireles skeyboard + mouse, but the lappy is barebones $500
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:01): you bought it online ?
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:02): dell sells direct
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:02): shipping might be more, it's america-based
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:03): a very nice laptop, though
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:03): (I recommend the bigger screen + more ram)
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:03): searching for it now :)
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:03): I was maybe gonna buy lenovo v100 or x60s thinkpad, although I'm not sure whether I will like 12Inch
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:04): hm, the dell site doesn't know b130 :)
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:05): sure it does
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:05): Shirakawasuna, where you bought it ?
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:05): http://www.dell.com/content/products/features.aspx/featured_basnb?c=us&cs=19&l=en&s=dhs
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:06): Shirakawasuna, you do any development also ?
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:07): I must say I was only looking at the latests and greates, probably I don't really need those specs anyways :)
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:07): no development
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:08): it compiles quite nicely, though
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:08): get the pentium-m if you want even better compiling
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:08): it has intel wireless (linux kernel support), ac97 audio, etc
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:08): well all those dual core's seem to be quite a lot faster
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:08): it's like an ibm.  The widescreen needs a VBIOS patch but besides that it's all good
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:08): core duos = faster + $
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:09): a laptop for 500 is nice value
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:09): can't go wrong with that
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:09): it's sturdy, too
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:10): not like a toshiba :)
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:10): I think I want a smaller screen though :)
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:10): this isn't bad either: http://www.dell.com/content/products/productdetails.aspx/entnb_e1405?c=us&cs=19&l=en&s=dhs
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:11): yeah looks nice, and 14 inch is more portable
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:13): hmm but that make me wanna buy one of $1000+ again :p
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:14): Shirakawasuna, where did you buy barebone then ?
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:14): you know
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:14): the base price
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:15): I didn't buy barebones, I upgraded the memory and screen
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:15): and recently purchased a new HD
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:15): for a cheap computer it's VERY nice
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:16): the only downside I've found is that xine and the XVideo extension do not work well with the intel 915...in fact not with the 830+, really
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:16): I was looking at this: http://www.pc.ibm.com/us/notebooks/thinkpad/x-series/index.html but can buy 3 b130's for that :)

6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:17): Shirakawasuna, ah that's too bad, however I don't really need super graphics also, intel had linux drivers, but last time I looked they where last released in 2000 ?
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:18): they're fine
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:18): it's just a xine libXv bug
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:18): I get good fps and can play some basic 3d games, etc
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:18): electricsheep looks wonderful
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:19): just not as good as w/ a graphics card, of course
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:20): *w/ glxgears
a9a6bd2cd664a685ecbac33d6bece9e0 (16:20): www.mountainmods.com/gallery <--- opinions?
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:21): Shirakawasuna, the only time I really use gl is in my screensaver :p
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:22): have you seen electricsheep?
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:22): best screensaver ever :)
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:22): hmm, didn't install it I think
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:23): crazy case-modders
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:24): ok installed it :), now downloading my first sheep
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:25): which seem to take forever
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:25): it changes all the time (if you have a network connection)
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:26): wow the screenshots look great indeed :)
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:26): I was expecting white sheeps bouncing through my screen :p
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:27): nope, it's great
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:28): I actually don't run it much anymore on the lappy because folding@home takes too much cpu for electricsheep to still look good
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:28): on my desktop I can run electricsheep and folding@home at the same time, though
a9a6bd2cd664a685ecbac33d6bece9e0 (16:29): Shirakawasuna: the crazy part is that the owners didn't mod the cases, that's the wey they bought them
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:29): hm, how about using javascript btw, to let unaware clients participate in things like electricsheep :p
a9a6bd2cd664a685ecbac33d6bece9e0 (16:30): i bought my first intel since the pentium pro 200 days last week. now i need a little help on buying a board. I know AMD i don't know intel
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:31): I know nothing about mobos
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:31): I haven't bought a computer besides my lappy in 7 years
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:31): longer, even
a9a6bd2cd664a685ecbac33d6bece9e0 (16:31): ah
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:31): the oldest parts still on my desktop are 7 years old
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:31): athlon tbird and abit kt7a-raid mobo
a9a6bd2cd664a685ecbac33d6bece9e0 (16:32): wow, and i thought i was old w/ my 4yrold dual MP system
6a702c604058bea73648584db122537b (16:32): Shirakawasuna, you can also build a great desktop for 500 euro :)
a9a6bd2cd664a685ecbac33d6bece9e0 (16:32): i want i guess the 975 chip set, and a baord that has a decent onboard raid controller
a9a6bd2cd664a685ecbac33d6bece9e0 (16:33): board even
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:35): I don't have money :)
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:36): I needed a laptop for college
874283016434bdfa1caa162b7fe7a5d2 (16:40): sleep time!
